// name: Replace with your package name (use @scope/name for scoped packages)
name: my-library
// version: Start at 0.1.0 — bump to 1.0.0 when your API is stable
// type: Source is ESM — CJS output is generated by the build step
// exports: Conditional exports: bundlers and Node ESM get .js, older CJS consumers get .cjs
// main: CJS fallback for older tools that don't understand the exports field
// types: TypeScript entry point for editors and type-checking
// files: Only ship dist/ to npm — source, tests, and config stay out of the package
// sideEffects: Tells bundlers this package has no side effects — enables tree-shaking
// publishConfig: Publish as public by default (required for scoped packages on npm)
// engines: Enforce minimum Node.js version — 20 is the current LTS baseline

scripts.// build: Compile to both ESM and CJS — use tsup, unbuild, or rollup
scripts.// test: Run tests with the built-in Node.js test runner
scripts.// lint: Run ESLint across the source tree
scripts.// prepublishOnly: Always build before publishing to ensure dist/ is fresh
